means: 滑，滑脱
犯过失，出错
（时间）不知不觉地过去
（健康状况等）变差
使顺利滑动
摆脱
放松，松开
跌倒，失足
纸条
失误，口误
事故
滑动的
可拆卸的
打有活结的
串行线路接口协议(Serial Line Interface Protocol)
Serial Line Internet Protocol串行线路接口协议，是旧式的协议

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"错误"或"缺点"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: error, fault, blunder, flaw, mistake, shortcoming, defect, slip
means: error ： 指思想或行动背离正题轨道或没有得到正确指引而出现的偏差或错误。
fault ： 一般指小并且可宽容的缺点、错误。
blunder ： 通常指由于无知或情况不明造成判断或行动上的大错。
flaw ： 指结构或组织上的缺点，如破裂之处。用作比喻意义时，指品格上的缺陷。
mistake ： 最普通用词，泛指思想上、行为上或认识上的判断或理解方面的错误。
shortcoming ： 指没有达到所要求的标准、没有充分发展或没尽到职责的不足、缺点或短处。多用复数形式。
defect ： 普通用词。指表面上的缺陷，或指人或物本质上的缺点。
slip ： 指因疏忽或无意而造成的差错。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"滑动"之意。
means: slip ： 指不自觉地、偶然地滑动。
glide ： 指自由、顺畅地流动，也指不费力、无声响地滑动。
slide ： 通常多指与光滑表面保持接触并且迅速地连续滑动。
skid ： 着重指不自主地或失去控制地滑动，特指车轮在结冰或潮湿路面上的滑动，常暗含有危险存在的意味。

word_mean: 在重力和水力综合作用下，土体或岩体整体下滑和位移现象。

sentence.Network_en: Emergency workers fear that the burning ship could slip its moorings.
sentence.Network_cn: 急救人员担心燃烧着的船只可能会脱链滑走。

sentence.Network_en: Slip-on shoes are easier to put on than lace-ups.
sentence.Network_cn: 一脚蹬比系带鞋容易穿。

sentence.Network_en: He might have let something slip in a moment of weakness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可能一时大意说漏了嘴。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新概念英语单词表带音标（第一册） - 豆丁网 ... ow 哎哟 slip 滑倒，滑了一脚 fall 落下，跌倒.
字典中滑字的解释 ... (7) 浮华不实[ showy] (1) 滑动;滑过[ slip;slide] (2) 中药。滑石[ talc].
高考阅读高频单词_百度文库 ... spill v. 溢出,溅出,倒出 9. slip v. 滑动,滑落；忽略 10. slide v. 滑动,滑落.
8. v.9.slip v. 滑动，滑落；忽略-

进出口专业英语词汇(H1) ... half silk 半丝织物 half slip 半裙 half smooth file 中齿锉.
保险行业英语 - 圈中人保险网 ... insurance coverage;risks covered 保险范围 insurance slip 投保单 insured amount 保险金额.
slip away什么意思_百度知道 ... away： 离开， slip away: 不要让明天溜走. slip away 逃走；悄悄溜走.

jx.jx_en_mean: reveal something inadvertently in the course of a conversation

lj.lj_ly: [with clause]Clive had let slip he was married.
lj.lj_ls: 克莱夫无意中说出他已经结婚了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (archaic)release a hound from the leash so as to begin the chase

lj.lj_ly: let slip the dogs of war.

phrase.cizu_name: let something slip through one's fingers (或 grasp)

jx.jx_en_mean: lose hold or possession of something
(或 the tongue)a minor mistake in writing (or speech)

phrase.cizu_name: there's many a slip 'twixt cup and lip

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)many things can go wrong between the start of a project and its completion; nothing is certain until it has happened
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)杯到嘴边还会失手（指万事难以十拿九稳，事情往往功败垂成）

jx.jx_en_mean: used to denote a small, slim person

lj.lj_ly: you are little more than a slip of a girl.
lj.lj_ls: 你还只是个瘦小的小姑娘。

lj.lj_ly: he lay there and quietly slipped away.
lj.lj_ls: 他静静地躺在那儿，安详地去世了。

lj.lj_ly: they often slipped up when it came to spelling.
lj.lj_ls: 一到拼写，他们就经常出差错。

phrase.cizu_name: slip one over on【非正式用语】

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'move quickly and softly'): probably from Middle Low German slippen (verb); compare with slippery
late Middle English: probably from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German slippe 'cut, strip'
mid 17th cent.: of obscure origin; compare with Norwegian slip(a) 'slime'

entry.def: If you slip, you accidentally slide and lose your balance.

example.ex: He had slipped on an icy pavement...
example.tran: 他在一条结了冰的人行道上滑了一跤。

example.ex: Be careful not to slip.
example.tran: 小心，别滑倒了。

entry.def: If something slips, it slides out of place or out of your hand.

example.ex: His glasses had slipped...
example.tran: 他的眼镜滑掉了。

example.ex: The hammer slipped out of her grasp.
example.tran: 锤子从她的手中滑落。

entry.tran: 迅速而悄无声息地走(到某处);溜(到某处)
entry.def: If you slip somewhere, you go there quickly and quietly.

example.ex: Amy slipped downstairs and out of the house...
example.tran: 埃米偷偷下楼溜出了房子。

example.ex: She slipped into the driving seat and closed the door.
example.tran: 她溜进了驾驶座，关上了门。

entry.tran: 迅速而不被注意地放置;偷偷塞进
entry.def: If you slip something somewhere, you put it there quickly in a way that does not attract attention.

example.ex: I slipped a note under Louise's door...
example.tran: 我偷偷在路易斯的房门下面塞了一张便条。

example.ex: He found a coin in his pocket and slipped it into her collecting tin...
example.tran: 他摸到口袋里有一枚硬币，便匆匆丢进她的讨钱罐。

entry.def: If you slip something to someone, you give it to them secretly.

example.ex: Robert had slipped her a note in school...
example.tran: 罗伯特在学校里偷偷地塞给她一张纸条。

example.ex: She looked round before pulling out a package and slipping it to the man.
example.tran: 她四下里看了看，然后拿出一个包裹，偷偷地塞给了这个男人。

entry.tran: 不知不觉地转入(某种状态);逐渐陷入(某种情况)
entry.def: To slip into a particular state or situation means to pass gradually into it, in a way that is hardly noticed.

example.ex: It amazed him how easily one could slip into a routine...
example.tran: 他惊异地发现人很容易在不知不觉中因循守旧起来。

example.ex: There was a 50-50 chance that the economy could slip back into recession.
example.tran: 经济再次陷入衰退的可能性是 50%。

entry.def: If something slips to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard.

example.ex: Shares slipped to 117p...
example.tran: 股价跌至 117 便士。

example.ex: The club had slipped to the bottom of Division Four...
example.tran: 该俱乐部已经跌为丁级组的最后一名。

entry.def: If you slip into or out of clothes or shoes, you put them on or take them off quickly and easily.

example.ex: She slipped out of the jacket and tossed it on the couch...
example.tran: 她麻利地脱下夹克，扔在了沙发上。

example.ex: I slipped off my woollen gloves.
example.tran: 我迅速地脱下了毛绒手套。

entry.def: A slip is a small or unimportant mistake.

example.ex: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
example.tran: 我们必须好好准备，不能出任何差错。

entry.def: A slip of paper is a small piece of paper.

example.ex: ...little slips of paper he had torn from a notebook...
example.tran: 他从笔记本上撕下来的一张张小纸片

example.ex: I put her name on the slip.
example.tran: 我在纸条上记下了她的名字。

entry.def: A slip is a thin piece of clothing that a woman wears under her dress or skirt.
If you refer to someone as a slip of a girl or a slip of a boy, you mean they are small, thin, and young.

example.ex: He's a mere slip of a lad compared to his brother...
example.tran: 跟他哥哥一比，他不过是个小毛孩。

example.ex: She was just a slip of a thing.
example.tran: 她才是个小丫头。

entry.def: If you give someone the slip, you escape from them when they are following you or watching you.

example.ex: He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.
example.tran: 他在午夜时分离开，避开了记者的追踪。

entry.def: If you let slip information, you accidentally tell it to someone, when you wanted to keep it secret.

example.ex: I bet he let slip that I'd gone to America.
example.tran: 我可以打赌，是他走漏了我去了美国的消息。

entry.def: If something slips your mind, you forget about it.

example.ex: The reason for my visit had obviously slipped his mind.
example.tran: 他显然已经忘掉了我的来意。

means.word_mean: 1. a socially awkward or tactless act
2. a minor inadvertent mistake usually observed in speech or writing or in small accidents or memory lapses etc.
3. potter's clay that is thinned and used for coating or decorating ceramics
4. a part (sometimes a root or leaf or bud) removed from a plant to propagate a new plant through rooting or grafting

sentences.sentence: "he's a mere slip of a lad"

means.word_mean: 6. a place where a craft can be made fast
7. an accidental misstep threatening (or causing) a fall;

sentences.sentence: "he blamed his slip on the ice"
"the jolt caused many slips and a few spills"
"he could feel the slickness of the tiller"

means.word_mean: 9. artifact consisting of a narrow flat piece of material
12. bed linen consisting of a cover for a pillow;

sentences.sentence: "the burglar carried his loot in a pillowcase"

means.word_mean: 14. a flight maneuver; aircraft slides sideways in the air
15. the act of avoiding capture (especially by cunning)

sentences.sentence: "The ship slipped away in the darkness"

means.word_mean: 2. insert inconspicuously or quickly or quietly;

sentences.sentence: "He slipped some money into the waiter's hand"

means.word_mean: 3. move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner;
6. to make a mistake or be incorrect

sentences.sentence: "He slipped me the key when nobody was looking"
"the artificial hip joint luxated and had to be put back surgically"

example.en: Don't slip up and pay this bill twice,please.
I slipped and gave the guy a 35 percent tip.
example.zh: 我出差错了，给了那个人百分之三十五的小费。

example.en: If your work doesn't improve, I will be forced to pink slip you.
example.zh: 如果你的工作不改进，那我就不得不解雇你了。

auth_sentence.content: They cannot afford to let it slip away.
auth_sentence.res_content: They cannot afford to let it slip away.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They cannot afford to let it slip away.

auth_sentence.content: You are not going to let this one slip.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are not going to let this one slip.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are not going to let this one slip.

auth_sentence.content: She...watched the life slip away from their waxen faces.
auth_sentence.res_content: She...watched the life slip away from their waxen faces.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She...watched the life slip away from their waxen faces.

Sentence.sentence: I was starting to feel like my whole world was falling apart – kind of slipping into a depression," said Carla.
J) "It drives you crazy, how easily kids slip into clichés(老生常谈),"says Boshoven.
In writing about their own experiences many applicants slip into clichés, thus failing to engage the reader
He is suspected of having slipped something in Kumar's bag.

sentences.en: He slipped and fell down the stairs.
sentences.cn: 他滑倒了, 从楼梯上摔了下来。

sentences.en: When she heard the news, the cup in her hand slipped down onto the floor.
sentences.cn: 当她听到这一消息时，手中的杯子一下子滑落掉在了地上。

means.word_mean: (时间)不知不觉地过去；悄悄逝去(away， by)

sentences.en: One week slipped away, but he wrote out nothing.
sentences.cn: 一个星期悄然逝去，他连一个字也没写出来。

sentences.en: He said his health was slipping.
sentences.cn: 他说他的身体一天不如一天了。

sentences.en: The flood has slipped below the warning stage.
sentences.cn: 洪水已降至警戒水位之下。

sentences.en: Passers-by would slip the beggar some change as they passed.
sentences.cn: 过路人从那乞丐身边走过时, 总会塞给他一点零钱。

sentences.en: Tom slipped a stamp to me.
sentences.cn: 汤姆悄悄地给我一张邮票。

sentences.en: The dog slipped its collar and ran away.
sentences.cn: 那条狗挣脱了项圈逃走了。

means.word_mean: 逃过; 被遗忘, 被忽视

sentences.en: Your name has slipped my mind.
What he said slips my mind.
sentences.cn: 我不知道他说了些什么。

sentences.en: One slip and you could fall off the building.
sentences.cn: 脚下一滑就可能从建筑物上跌下去。

sentences.en: There are a few trivial slips in this lesson.
sentences.cn: 在这篇课文中有几个小错误。

jushi.english: One day he slipped and hurt his leg.
jushi.chinese: 有一天他滑倒把腿摔坏了。

jushi.english: She slipped and fell down the stairs.
jushi.chinese: 她滑倒了,从楼梯上摔了下来。
